DataElement.preferredName: Product Adverse Event To Action Relationship Delay Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time delay between and adverse event and a product action taken relationship.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Product Adverse Event To Action Relationship Delay Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A thing done.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.:The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Product Adverse Event To Action Relationship
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A thing done.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

Concepts.definition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval.  mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains PQ to have units that describe a period of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
